snippet: The police action, with water cannons and tear gas, was the latest crackdown by Turkey’s government against a movement challenging plans to redevelop a park.
abstract: Turkish police attack group of peaceful demonstrators in Istanbul's Taksim Square with water cannons and tear gas, latest violent crackdown by the government against growing protest movement challenging plans to replace park with luxury shopping mall.

byline.original: By TIM ARANGO and CEYLAN YEGINSU
byline.contributor: Sebnem Arsu contributed reporting from Antakya, Turkey.

lead_paragraph: The police action, with water cannons and tear gas, was the latest crackdown by Turkey’s government against a movement challenging plans to redevelop a park.

headline.seo: Police Attack Protesters in Istanbul’s Taksim Square
headline.main: Peaceful Protest Over Istanbul Park Turns Violent as Police Crack Down
headline.print_headline: Peaceful Protest Over Istanbul Park Turns Violent as Police Crack Down
